data.title: Cootehill News
data.meta_description: Selby to steal the show with super snooker Exhibition
data.text:
Selby to steal the show with super snooker Exhibition

Snooker fans in Co. Cavan are in for a treat when snooker star Mark Selby comes to Cootehill for an exhibition night next week. The exhibition, sponsored by Sean Shields Bookmakers, takes place in the Errigal Hotel, Cootehill on Friday 28th September and is a must for all cue-sports fans. Without doubt a rising star on the snooker circuit and now one of the most famous snooker players, Mark Selby is a born entertainer and is sure to delight and please his large army of fans in Cavan. The special guest on the night is Stephen Dempsey, the current European Pool champion. Stephen recently became Ireland's first ever European Men's Pool Champion and at 18 years of age was the youngest ever winner of the event. The format of the night will involve a number of local players playing against Mark and Stephen at pool as well as a special quick fire match between the two stars. To conclude the evening Stephen will demonstrate some of his amazing trick-shots for which he's now renowned. Among the players competing against Mark and Stephen on the night will include a number of players from the current Cavan pool team as well as a number of local people. All players will play 2 frames against Mark and Stephen before they have a special quick-fire match between the 2 stars. Players competing on the night will include Junior International James McDonald from Drumgoon, County Cavan players Darren Scorr and Gerard Smith from Cootehill as well as some local players such as Kevin McDonnell, Kevin McCluskey and Warren Hall. Again one of the highlights will surely be Stephen Dempsey demonstrating some of his amazing trick-shots of which a DVD will be on sale at the night. Indeed on the night there will be an official launch of the DVD which includes a demonstration of 50 amazing pool trick-shots as well as an explanation by Stephen on exactly how he performs these amazing trick-shots. Compere for the night will be local businessman Gerry McDonagh. There will be a raffle also for a specially autographed cue on the night and a chance to play in a special game of doubles with the two players. Both Mark Selby and Stephen Dempsey will be available for autographs and photographs during the night. Tickets, which are limited for the evening are on sale in the following outlets: Errigal Hotel, Cootehill. There are also some corporate tickets still available where a frame can be sponsored on the night. Further details are available from 086-8211302.

Excellent Junior Certificate Results At St. Aidan's

Junior Certificate students at St. Aidan's Comprehensive School, Cootehill were exuberant when they received their results on Wednesday 12th September. The results are a reflection of the students' hard work, a dedicated teaching staff and supportive parents. An atmosphere of excitement and celebration was evident in the school. The entire staff of St. Aidan's would like to congratulate the students and wish them success as they embark upon their Leaving Certificate cycle.

Library events

Cootehill Library has this week published it's programme of involvement in the very popular Gerard Whelan Remembered Weekend which runs 20th - 23rd 2007. Dermot Healy novelist, playwright, and poet will visit Cootehill Library to give a reading of his work on Saturday 22nd of September at 4pm. This is a wonderful opportunity for readers to listen to this notable Cavan literary figure who has won the Hennessy Award (1974 and 1976), the Tom Gallon Award (1983), and the Encore Award (1995). The event is free of charge but do arrive early to avoid disappointment. The library holds a number of Healy's books which are available for lending for those who wish to get to know a bit more about his work. For information please ring 049 5559873. Painting Circle with Ray Savage begins on Tuesday 9th October, 6.30pm-8.30pm and continues every Tuesday for six weeks. Join with other painting enthusiasts. Use your own chosen medium - oils, watercolour or acrylics. Bring your materials and Ray will guide you through to a finished painting. Cost ยง25. Booking essential.

Ballroom dancing

Cootehil Ballroom Dancing will take place at Errigal House Hotel Cootehill on Wednesday 19th September with music by Lime Light, a big performer on the night. More ballroom at the same venue on Wednesday 26th September with music by Breige Kelly and Michael Clary. Everyone welcome to come along.

Comhaltas

Pat McCabe's Music Class has re-commenced on Thursday evenings. The class begins at 6.00pm and will take place in St Michael's Hall Cootehill. New members are welcome.

Social evening in Health Centre

Social Evening-will be held in the Darley Health Centre on Thursday 4th October from 7.30pm to 9.30pm. Refreshments will be served and entertainment provided. Over 50's and all welcome to attend.

United Christian Aid

The annual collection of clothes, footwear, household goods and toys will take place in Gallonray House Maudabawn on Thursday 20th September and Friday 21st September between 7.00 and 9.00pm for distribution to Moldova. This collection is organised by local committee. All donations are greatly donated.

Blood clinic

Blood Donation Clinic-will take place at St Michael's Hall Cootehill on Wednesday 26th and Thursday 27th September 2007, from 4.30-9.00pm each day. If you are not a blood donor already, please think about coming along to our clinic. If you are already a donor or have given before, thank you, and if you can, come again. Bring a friend, we welcome all donors, new and old.

Irish Hospice

A coffee day will be held in Gallonray House Maudabawn on Thursday 20th September from 10.00am to6.00pm. This will be sponsored by Bewleys and all funds raised will be donated to St Christopher's Hospice Cavan where great care is given to patients suffering from Cancer, M.S. and Motor Neurone disease. Please come along and join us for a cup of coffee and donate ยง2 to the hospice. If you are unable to get to Gallonray House and wish to make a donation please contact Mary O'Reilly (Kilcloght) at 049 5552722, Barbara McKeague at 042 9660193 or John at Gallonray House.

Tumbler Tots Day Care Service

This service is provided in Cootehill Resource House at 82 and 118 Drumnaveil Cootehill. There are some places available for 'Full Day' care service, 1.30-6.00pm Monday to Friday on a first come first served basis. Further details can be provided if you ring 049 5556011.

Cootehill Badminton

The club recommences in St Michael's Hall on Monday next 17th September. Juniors from 7.00pm to 8.30pm, adults from 8.30pm onwards. Adult numbers are low so new adult members will be most welcome.

St Joseph's Young Priests Society

Church gate collection takes place on Saturday 22nd September and Sunday 23rd September at St Michael's Church Cootehill, St Mary's Middle Chapel and St Patrick's Church Maudabawn. Your support would be very much appreciated. A house-to-house collection will not take place this year.

Drumlin Athletic Club

Weekly training for all age groups now takes place in Kill GAA Pitch, Rathluden on Tuesday evenings , from 6 to 7pm, New members are most welcome.

Table Quiz

A table quiz will take place in Connolly's Bar Cootehill on Friday 28th September starting at 10.00pm, each table of four costing ยง20. All proceeds will be presented to Sr Muriel who despite having reached the wonderful age of 84 years continues to work among the aged people in the hills of Bosnia.

Cootehill Beaver Scouts

The local scouts will hold their enrolment evening on Wednesday 19th September in St Michael's Hall. Enrolment will take place between 6.30 and 7.30pm. Weekly meetings will commence on Monday 24th September from the new time of 6pm-7pm.. For further information please contact 086 1017475.

Flag day

Tanagh Branch ONET will hold it's Annual Flag Day on Saturday 22nd September 2007. We are a charitable organisation and all funds collected will go to worthy causes both locally and nationally.

On Your Feet

A meeting will be held in the White Horse Hotel on Tuesday 25th September at 8.00pm to take our walking club a step further. For all those interested in walking it is important to attend. It is vital that we have a good turn out to show that we are serious about the developments of our walks in this area. Don't leave it to someone else, come along. We have a number of speakers lined up to speak on the benefits of walking on the night, looking forward to seeing you there.

Coffee Day

Chris McEnroe 13 Cavan Road Cootehill will host her annual Hospice coffee day on Thursday 20th September from 10am to 6pm. In the event that you are unable to attend and wish to make a donation please contact Dr Fional O'Hea or Chris McEnroe. All proceeds to St Christopher's Hospice Cavan.

Huge Honour

Local woman Patricia Gardiner has recently had the honour of having a wing of Perry Street Children's Orphanage in Nairobi, Kenya Africa named after her. This is quite an honour for a white Irish woman to receive from Leah Ambwaya, Director of the 'Child First Trust'. Many of the babies in this wing were picked out of garbage bins, some as young as one day old. They were washed and clothed, christened, and as Patricia said "given a right to life". The wing is aptly named the 'Trish Gardiner baby Home. This huge honour was bestowed on Patricia for her unending work and fundraising for this cause. On the recent walk from Tullyvin to Cootehill organised by Patricia the final figure raised was an astounding ยง23,600.

New2u-Charity Shop

The shop is hosting a yard sale this Saturday 22nd September. The sale will run from 11.30am to 2.00pm. There is a large selection of good quality second-hand furniture and nursery items. Weather permitting the sale will take place in the fellowship yard at the back of the building, otherwise it will be held indoors. Donations of furniture are welcome, please contact 087 2254999 or 087 7406746 to arrange pickup. Thank you for your continued support to the shop. It has been a great success. We are currently financially supporting a project in Tanzania as well as sending on containers of clothes, which are distributed to those in need in the community. Please continue to donate your bric-a-brac, shoes, clothes etc as they are always welcome. Shop opening hours Thursday 5. 30pm to 8.00pm and Friday, Saturday from 11.00am to 5.00pm.

Gospel Concert

A special Gospel Concert will take place in Corcaghan Community Centre on the Monaghan to Cootehill Road on Saturday 29th September 2007 starting at 8.00pm. All proceeds to the Persecuted Church abroad. The concert will feature Parker Donnelly, Kenny Archer, Amy Roberts, Paul and Sharon Acheson with a report by David turner. Freewill offering and refreshments will be served. Everyone welcome to come along.
